pr_title: A new end point to get resource group stats

timeline.message:
An end point to get resource group level stats

A load balancer can use resource group level stats to do better
load balancing. "/v1/resourceGroupState/fullStatsOnly/" end point
is added to obtain resource groups level stats. The end point
returns ResourceGroupInfo that does not contain the running or queued queries.

An end point to get resource group level stats

A load balancer can use resource group level stats to do better
load balancing. The new endpoint returns a ResourceGroupInfo.
ResourceGroupInfo contains a list of ResourceGroupInfo's as its subtrees.
ResourceGroupInfo consists of basic stats (running and queued query counts)
and actual queries as strings. This method leaves the queries empty
since it is not needed.

An end point to get resource group level stats

A load balancer can use resource group level stats to do better
load balancing. The new endpoint returns a ResourceGroupInfo.
ResourceGroupInfo contains a list of ResourceGroupInfo's as its subtrees.
ResourceGroupInfo consists of basic stats (running and queued query counts)
and actual queries as strings. This method leaves the queries empty
since it is not needed. The end method does not return the dynamically
generated the resource groups.

timeline.bodyText: do we envision this endpoint to stay longer, if yes then i would say let's make it little little more generic, i.e. by taking a key=value as input where isStatic=true and use that instead of dedicating the entire endpoing to pull static resource group.
timeline.author: swapsmagic
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -68,6 +68,27 @@ public ResourceGroupInfo getQueryStateInfos(@PathParam("resourceGroupId") String
         throw new WebApplicationException(NOT_FOUND);
     }
 
+    @GET
+    @Produces(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON)
+    @Encoded
+    @Path("getStaticResourceGroupInfo/{resourceGroupId: .+}")

replies.bodyText: Makes sense I will change it. We should be able to receive the whole tree if needed.
replies.author: cemcayiroglu

timeline.bodyText: Should we add a static resource group check invariant here. If somehow we make a call to this function and it is not static, then it should return a null (preferably an Optional.empty()) or raise an UnsupportedOperationException ?
timeline.author: mayankgarg1990

replies.bodyText: Makes sense. I am going to add it.
replies.author: cemcayiroglu

timeline.bodyText: do we really need both of these? Should we just keep the OptionalInt one?
timeline.author: mayankgarg1990

timeline.bodyText: Optional.of() will never return a null. You probably want to change this to Optional.of(requireNonNull())
timeline.author: mayankgarg1990

timeline.bodyText: Can you better explain the decision to go for a separate class, rather than maybe just adding dynamicFragmentId here directly?
timeline.author: mayankgarg1990

replies.bodyText: I was thinking that we could add more properties here. Swapnil had some plans. I can change it to dynamicFragmentId. Another option was adding this to the ResourceGroupId directly.
replies.author: cemcayiroglu

timeline.bodyText: Could we add a getter to the context class and just check that it's present and equal to the id's segment count?  This would be OK if we had Java pattern matching :)
timeline.author: tdcmeehan

timeline.bodyText: In my opinion the name is redundant, since the class is called InternalResourceGroup.  How about isStatic?
timeline.author: tdcmeehan

timeline.bodyText: Not sure I follow this.  Isn't this just checking if the present RG is static?  If so, why the name?
timeline.author: tdcmeehan

replies.bodyText: This is actually checking if the sub resource groups is dynamic.
replies.author: cemcayiroglu

timeline.bodyText: It seems like we're changing the semantics of this method.  It's not really just expanding the template into a resource group id, it's giving you an entire selection context.  I would keep this method unchanged but make it private, and make a new method which calls this method to get the id, and also does the below (and it's public).
timeline.author: tdcmeehan

timeline.bodyText: similar way as mentioned above, can we make this a generic method/lambda, i.e. getInfo with filter (i.e. group.isStaticResourceGroup being passed in the argument of the method and used here).
timeline.author: swapsmagic

replies.bodyText: Sure, I am going to update.
replies.author: cemcayiroglu

timeline.bodyText: Coudn't understand the logic here, how are we deciding if a subgroup is static vs dynamic.  can you explain the logic here?
timeline.author: swapsmagic

replies.bodyText:
resourceGroupSelectionContext is holding the dynamic segment index.
For example:
abc_static.xyx_static.qwe_dynamic.sdq_static.
dynamic segment index is 2.
id.segment.size() is giving the size of the parent. This is also the index of the subgroup. so if parent.segment.size == dynamic segment index than the sub groups is dynamic.
replies.author: cemcayiroglu

timeline.bodyText: Why is this true? Sorry I don't have much background about resource group.
timeline.author: shixuan-fan

replies.bodyText: I guess the root resource group is always static
replies.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText:
question: Why do we need a separate method? It is technically very similar to the getQueryStateInfos. It feels like it is possible to simply add a parameter to the getQueryStateInfos.
For example:

?includeQueryInfo=true|false
?summarizeSubgroups=true|false
?includeDynamicSubgroups=true|false

Or maybe something like:

?subgroupsInfo={SUMMARIZE|STATIC|ALL}
timeline.author: arhimondr
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -68,6 +68,27 @@ public ResourceGroupInfo getQueryStateInfos(@PathParam("resourceGroupId") String
         throw new WebApplicationException(NOT_FOUND);
     }
 
+    @GET
+    @Produces(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON)
+    @Encoded
+    @Path("getResourceGroupInfo/{resourceGroupId: .+}")
+    public ResourceGroupInfo getStaticResourceGroupInfo(@PathParam("resourceGroupId") String resourceGroupIdString)

timeline.bodyText: How about firstDynamicSegmentPosition (same for the getter)?
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText:
Why is it needed?
If it is needed indeed - we should explicitly annotate all parameters of the constructor as we do for other Json serializable objects (e.g.: https://github.com/prestodb/presto/blob/master/presto-main/src/main/java/com/facebook/presto/execution/QueryInfo.java#L82)
timeline.author: arhimondr

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/presto-main/src/main/java/com/facebook/presto/server/ResourceGroupInfo.java b/presto-main/src/main/java/com/facebook/presto/server/ResourceGroupInfo.java
index 5cfe21510e..07065285b7 100644
--- a/presto-main/src/main/java/com/facebook/presto/server/ResourceGroupInfo.java
+++ b/presto-main/src/main/java/com/facebook/presto/server/ResourceGroupInfo.java

@@ -54,25 +54,20 @@ public class ResourceGroupInfo
 
     @JsonCreator
     public ResourceGroupInfo(
-            ResourceGroupId id,
-            ResourceGroupState state,
-
-            SchedulingPolicy schedulingPolicy,
-            int schedulingWeight,
-
-            DataSize softMemoryLimit,
-            int softConcurrencyLimit,
-            int hardConcurrencyLimit,
-            int maxQueuedQueries,
-
-            DataSize memoryUsage,
-            int numQueuedQueries,
-            int numRunningQueries,
-            int numEligibleSubGroups,
-
-            List<ResourceGroupInfo> subGroups,
-
-            List<QueryStateInfo> runningQueries)
+            @JsonProperty("id") ResourceGroupId id,
+            @JsonProperty("state") ResourceGroupState state,
+            @JsonProperty("schedulingPolicy") SchedulingPolicy schedulingPolicy,
+            @JsonProperty("schedulingWeight") int schedulingWeight,
+            @JsonProperty("softMemoryLimit") DataSize softMemoryLimit,
+            @JsonProperty("softConcurrencyLimit") int softConcurrencyLimit,
+            @JsonProperty("hardConcurrencyLimit") int hardConcurrencyLimit,
+            @JsonProperty("maxQueuedQueries") int maxQueuedQueries,
+            @JsonProperty("memoryUsage") DataSize memoryUsage,
+            @JsonProperty("numQueuedQueries") int numQueuedQueries,
+            @JsonProperty("numRunningQueries") int numRunningQueries,
+            @JsonProperty("numEligibleSubGroups") int numEligibleSubGroups,
+            @JsonProperty("subGroups") List<ResourceGroupInfo> subGroups,
+            @JsonProperty("runningQueries") List<QueryStateInfo> runningQueries)
     {
         this.id = requireNonNull(id, "id is null");
         this.state = requireNonNull(state, "state is null");

timeline.bodyText: nit: s/isStatic/static/. By convention boolean variables in java are declared without is. Geter names for boolean variables are constructed as is + VariableName.
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: How about changing this method signature to something like public ResourceGroupInfo getFullInfo(boolean includeQueryInfo, boolean summarizeSubgroups, boolean includeDynamicSubgroups)?
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: This code is a little bit hard to follow. Could you please explain why is it needed to pass the OptionalInt dynamicSegmentPosition as a parameter? And why simple boolean is not enough? It feels like createGroupIfNecessary could be setting this boolean.
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.message:
An end point to get resource group level stats

A load balancer can use resource group level stats to do better
load balancing. The new endpoint returns a ResourceGroupInfo.
ResourceGroupInfo contains a list of ResourceGroupInfo's as its subtrees.
ResourceGroupInfo consists of basic stats (running and queued query counts)
and actual queries as strings. This method leaves the queries empty
since it is not needed. The end method does not return the dynamically
generated the resource groups.

timeline.bodyText: Given we mark a group with static group or non static group, we should renameincludeDynamicSubGroup to includeStaticGroupOnly and use it as per it's name. Calling this flag includeDynamicSubGroup makes it non align with how we mark the resource group.
timeline.author: swapsmagic

timeline.bodyText: dynamic to be renamed as staticOnly and use it accordingly. Makes it much more clear with the staticResourceGroup flag.
timeline.author: swapsmagic

timeline.bodyText: we can just call is static. ResourceGroup is redundant here.
timeline.author: swapsmagic

replies.bodyText: static is a reserved key word.
replies.author: cemcayiroglu

replies.bodyText: It used to be isStatic. I suggested to rename it to static, as usually in java the convention is to call boolean variables without is, and then add the is prefix for a getter. Let's keep it as is.
replies.author: arhimondr

timeline.author: swapsmagic

replies.bodyText: We had a offline chat with @swapsmagic. We concluded that introducing a segment class would require a major code change. We are going to keep it as is.
replies.author: cemcayiroglu

timeline.bodyText: may be call this as includeStaticSubgroupsOnly to make it consistent with how we tag the resource group.
timeline.author: swapsmagic
